item.title: CVE-2007-2447 - Samba usermap script
item.description: Samba 3.0.0 - 3.0.25rc3 are subject for Remote Command Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2007-2447), allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands by specifying a username containing shell meta characters. TL;DR Link to heading The root cause is passing unfiltered user input provided via MS-RPC calls to /bin/sh when invoking non-default "username map script" configuration option in smb.conf, so no authentication is needed to exploit this vulnerability.
